intro: Restrepiopsis striata, commonly known as the striped restrepiopsis, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, elongated leaves with distinct longitudinal stripes. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
